elements.desc:
The `google-castable-video` element enables your HTML5 videos to be casted to any Chromecast.

It behaves exactly like an HTML5 video element except for some added methods and events.

Instead of listening for the video element's `timeupdate` event please listen for the `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event. This event is fired if the video is playing locally and on the Chromecast device.

##### Example

    <video is="google-castable-video">
      <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
    </video>

events.desc:
The `google-castable-video-casting` event is fired whenever the
connection status to a Chromecast changes. Use this to change the cast icon.

jsdoc.description:
The `google-castable-video-casting` event is fired whenever the
connection status to a Chromecast changes. Use this to change the cast icon.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * The `google-castable-video-casting` event is fired whenever the
       * connection status to a Chromecast changes. Use this to change the cast icon.
       *
       * @event google-castable-video-casting
       * @param {Object} detail
       *   @param {bool} detail.casting True if connected.

events.name: google-castable-video-casting

events.desc:
The `google-castable-video-error` event is fired whenever
an error occurs.

jsdoc.description:
The `google-castable-video-error` event is fired whenever
an error occurs.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * The `google-castable-video-error` event is fired whenever
       * an error occurs.
       *
       * @event google-castable-video-error
       * @param {Object} detail
       *   @param {string} detail.error The error type.

events.name: google-castable-video-error

events.desc:
The `google-castable-video-initialized` event is fired when
the cast client API has been initialized.

jsdoc.description:
The `google-castable-video-initialized` event is fired when
the cast client API has been initialized.
jsdoc.orig:
*
           * The `google-castable-video-initialized` event is fired when

           *
           * @event google-castable-video-initialized

events.name: google-castable-video-initialized

events.desc:
The `google-castable-video-receiver-status` event is fired whenever
the availability of Chromecasts changes. Use this to show or hide the cast icon.

jsdoc.description:
The `google-castable-video-receiver-status` event is fired whenever
the availability of Chromecasts changes. Use this to show or hide the cast icon.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * The `google-castable-video-receiver-status` event is fired whenever
       * the availability of Chromecasts changes. Use this to show or hide the cast icon.
       *
       * @event google-castable-video-receiver-status
       * @param {Object} detail
       *   @param {bool} detail.available Shows if receivers are available.

events.name: google-castable-video-receiver-status

events.desc:
The `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event is fired whenever
the video's playback position changes.

jsdoc.description:
The `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event is fired whenever
the video's playback position changes.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * The `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event is fired whenever
       * the video's playback position changes.
       *
       * @event google-castable-video-timeupdate
       * @param {Object} detail
       *   @param {number} detail.currentTime The current video position.

events.name: google-castable-video-timeupdate

properties.name: appId
properties.desc: The appId that references which receiver the Chromecast will load.

properties.name: bothCurrentTime
properties.desc:
Sets or returns the current playback position (in seconds).
Since the local video is paused when the video is playing on the Chromecast device
the objects currentTime property doesn't represent the actual currentTime of the video
playing on the Chromecast device. To always get the actual position please use bothCurrentTime.

properties.name: launchSessionManager
properties.desc:
Call this when the user clicks the cast icon.
Opens the cast extension to create a session with the selected receiver.

properties.name: pause
properties.desc: Call the `pause` method from your controls.

properties.name: play
properties.desc: Call the `play` method from your controls.

properties.name: _bothPaused
properties.desc: The real paused state for local and cast playback.

properties.name: _castMedia
properties.desc: The `chrome.cast.Media` object.

properties.name: _casting
properties.desc: The mode state depending on whether the video is playing locally or on the cast device.

properties.name: _initializeCastApi
properties.desc: Called internally when the cast sender api has been loaded.

properties.name: _onMediaDiscovered
properties.desc: or was already playing on cast device.

properties.name: _onSeeked
properties.desc: Redirecting `seeked` event to Chromecast.

properties.name: _onTimeupdate
properties.desc: Redirecting `timeupdate` event to `google-castable-video-timeupdate`.

properties.name: _onVolumechange
properties.desc: Redirecting `volumechange` event to Chromecast.

properties.name: _receiverAvailable
properties.desc: Returns if any Chromecast is available.

properties.name: _session
properties.desc: The `chrome.cast.Session` object.

properties.name: _sessionUpdateListener
properties.desc: Internal method gets called when the cast session status changes.

properties.name: _synchronizeMedia
properties.desc: Internal method to synchronize the media objects.

properties.name: _triggerAvailability
properties.desc:
The `google-castable-video-receiver-status` event is fired whenever
the availability of Chromecasts changes. Use this to show or hide the cast icon.

properties.name: _triggerCasting
properties.desc:
The `google-castable-video-casting` event is fired whenever the
connection status to a Chromecast changes. Use this to change the cast icon.

properties.name: _triggerError
properties.desc:
The `google-castable-video-error` event is fired whenever
an error occurs.

properties.name: _triggerTimeupdate
properties.desc:
The `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event is fired whenever
the video's playback position changes.

google-castable-video.desc:
The `google-castable-video` element enables your HTML5 videos to be casted to any Chromecast.

It behaves exactly like an HTML5 video element except for some added methods and events.

Instead of listening for the video element's `timeupdate` event please listen for the `google-castable-video-timeupdate` event. This event is fired if the video is playing locally and on the Chromecast device.

##### Example

    <video is="google-castable-video">
      <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
    </video>
